milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.title: cocos' -p option won't change the package name of the generated android project.
data.body:
cocos new -p com.xx.xxx -l lua
When I create a new project with the command line above, the package name of the generated android project is still org.cocos2dx.lua.

data.title: gen_prebuildlibs no longer works correctly on windows, Remove it

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
The script `gen_prebuild_libs.py` goes into an endless loop on Windows 7 (64bit) and Windows 8.1 (64bit).
This can be fixed by changing `continue` to `break` on line 199. Not sure if that is the correct thing to do.

The configuration in `build_config.json` is outdated:
- `build/cocos2d-win32.vc2013.sln` was renamed to `build/cocos2d-win32.sln`
- `libcocosdenshion`, `libchipmunk` and `libcocosbuilder` are prebuild now and are no longer present in `cocos2d-win32.sln` (i probably missed a couple)
- `libbullet` and `librecast` have been added to `cocos2d-win32.sln`

If this script is still meant to be used (and supported), please fix the script.

data.title: Scene can't have std::vector member

milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.body:
Creating a class that inherits from cocos2d::Scene, and giving it a std::vector member variable causes a runtime error but compiles fine.  The error I get is "vector iterators incompatible" and occurs on line457 of CCNavMesh.cpp.  (Im running windows7 and visual studio 2013 update 4)

This bug is related to the physics code since disabling CC_USE_PHYSICS no longer produces an error.

This bug is new to v3.7.

data.title: cmake now supports windows store apps
data.body:
I don't know if you guys are aware or not but MS have sponsored some work on cmake

https://github.com/Microsoft/CMake

cmake can now generate projects using xaml files and can target windows phone winRT universal app etc.

All the more reason to move to a full cmake build system for cocos2d-x
